name: Policy Reinstatement from Notice of Cancellation
description: Allows underwriters to reinstate policies that are in Notice of Cancellation status and sync the status changes with IMS

background.text: I am logged in as an Underwriter
I have access to the EOX application

scenarios.name: Successfully reinstate policy from Notice of Cancellation status

steps.text: I am viewing the applications list
there is an application with 'Notice of Cancellation' status
I right-click on the application
I click on the 'Reinstate' action button
the Application Status should change to 'Reinstated'
the reinstatement process should be triggered

scenarios.name: Application status updates to Bound after IMS binding completion

steps.text: I have successfully triggered reinstatement for a policy
the Application Status is 'Reinstated'
the reinstatement is bound in IMS
IMS Status changes to 'Bound'
the system should fetch the updated IMS status
the Application Status in EOX should change to 'Bound'

scenarios.name: Reinstate action is visible for Notice of Cancellation applications

steps.text: I am viewing an application with 'Notice of Cancellation' status
I right-click on the application
I should see 'Reinstate' as one of the available action buttons
the 'Reinstate' button should be clickable

scenarios.name: Multiple policies can be reinstated sequentially

steps.text: I have multiple applications with 'Notice of Cancellation' status
I reinstate the first application
I reinstate the second application
both applications should show 'Reinstated' status
both reinstatement processes should be triggered independently

scenarios.name: Policy reinstatement with successful IMS synchronization

steps.text: I have an application in 'Notice of Cancellation' status
I trigger the reinstatement process
the reinstatement syncs successfully with IMS
the IMS binding process should complete
the final status should be 'Bound' in both systems

scenarios.name: Application list displays Notice of Cancellation policies correctly

steps.text: there are applications with various statuses including 'Notice of Cancellation'
I view the applications list
I should see applications with 'Notice of Cancellation' status clearly displayed
these applications should be accessible for right-click actions

scenarios.name: Reinstate action is not available for non-Notice of Cancellation applications

steps.text: I am viewing an application with 'Active' status
I right-click on the application
I should not see 'Reinstate' in the available action buttons
only appropriate actions for the current status should be displayed

scenarios.name: Handle IMS synchronization failure during reinstatement

steps.text: I have triggered reinstatement for a policy
the Application Status is 'Reinstated'
IMS synchronization fails
I should receive an error notification
the system should handle the sync failure gracefully

scenarios.name: Unauthorized user cannot access reinstate functionality

steps.text: I am logged in as a non-Underwriter user
there is an application with 'Notice of Cancellation' status
I right-click on the application
I should not see the 'Reinstate' action button
I should not be able to trigger the reinstatement process
I have an application in 'Notice of Cancellation' status
I click on the 'Reinstate' action button
a network timeout occurs during the process
I should receive a timeout error message
the system should maintain data integrity

scenarios.name: Reinstate policy that was recently moved to Notice of Cancellation

steps.text: an application has just changed to 'Notice of Cancellation' status
I immediately attempt to reinstate the policy
the reinstatement should process successfully
there should be no timing conflicts

scenarios.name: Reinstate policy with maximum allowed data in application fields

steps.text: I have an application with maximum data length in all fields
the application status is 'Notice of Cancellation'
I trigger the reinstatement process
the reinstatement should complete successfully
all data should be preserved during the status change

scenarios.name: System behavior with concurrent reinstatement attempts

steps.text: I have an application in 'Notice of Cancellation' status
I click the 'Reinstate' button multiple times rapidly
the system should process only one reinstatement request
duplicate requests should be prevented or handled gracefully

gherkin_content:
Feature: Policy Reinstatement from Notice of Cancellation
  Allows underwriters to reinstate policies that are in Notice of Cancellation status and sync the status changes with IMS

  Background:
    Given I am logged in as an Underwriter
    And I have access to the EOX application

  @smoke @positive
  Scenario: Successfully reinstate policy from Notice of Cancellation status
    Given I am viewing the applications list
    And there is an application with 'Notice of Cancellation' status
    When I right-click on the application
    And I click on the 'Reinstate' action button
    Then the Application Status should change to 'Reinstated'
    And the reinstatement process should be triggered

  @positive @integration
  Scenario: Application status updates to Bound after IMS binding completion
    Given I have successfully triggered reinstatement for a policy
    And the Application Status is 'Reinstated'
    When the reinstatement is bound in IMS
    And IMS Status changes to 'Bound'
    Then the system should fetch the updated IMS status
    And the Application Status in EOX should change to 'Bound'

  @positive @ui
  Scenario: Reinstate action is visible for Notice of Cancellation applications
    Given I am viewing an application with 'Notice of Cancellation' status
    When I right-click on the application
    Then I should see 'Reinstate' as one of the available action buttons
    And the 'Reinstate' button should be clickable

  @positive @multiple
  Scenario: Multiple policies can be reinstated sequentially
    Given I have multiple applications with 'Notice of Cancellation' status
    When I reinstate the first application
    And I reinstate the second application
    Then both applications should show 'Reinstated' status
    And both reinstatement processes should be triggered independently

  @positive @sync
  Scenario: Policy reinstatement with successful IMS synchronization
    Given I have an application in 'Notice of Cancellation' status
    When I trigger the reinstatement process
    And the reinstatement syncs successfully with IMS
    Then the IMS binding process should complete
    And the final status should be 'Bound' in both systems

  @positive @display
  Scenario: Application list displays Notice of Cancellation policies correctly
    Given there are applications with various statuses including 'Notice of Cancellation'
    When I view the applications list
    Then I should see applications with 'Notice of Cancellation' status clearly displayed
    And these applications should be accessible for right-click actions

  @negative @validation
  Scenario: Reinstate action is not available for non-Notice of Cancellation applications
    Given I am viewing an application with 'Active' status
    When I right-click on the application
    Then I should not see 'Reinstate' in the available action buttons
    And only appropriate actions for the current status should be displayed

  @negative @error-handling
  Scenario: Handle IMS synchronization failure during reinstatement
    Given I have triggered reinstatement for a policy
    And the Application Status is 'Reinstated'
    When IMS synchronization fails
    Then I should receive an error notification
    And the system should handle the sync failure gracefully

  @negative @security
  Scenario: Unauthorized user cannot access reinstate functionality
    Given I am logged in as a non-Underwriter user
    And there is an application with 'Notice of Cancellation' status
    When I right-click on the application
    Then I should not see the 'Reinstate' action button
    And I should not be able to trigger the reinstatement process

  @negative @timeout
  Scenario: Network timeout during reinstatement process
    Given I have an application in 'Notice of Cancellation' status
    When I click on the 'Reinstate' action button
    And a network timeout occurs during the process
    Then I should receive a timeout error message
    And the system should maintain data integrity

  @edge-case @timing
  Scenario: Reinstate policy that was recently moved to Notice of Cancellation
    Given an application has just changed to 'Notice of Cancellation' status
    When I immediately attempt to reinstate the policy
    Then the reinstatement should process successfully
    And there should be no timing conflicts

  @edge-case @boundary
  Scenario: Reinstate policy with maximum allowed data in application fields
    Given I have an application with maximum data length in all fields
    And the application status is 'Notice of Cancellation'
    When I trigger the reinstatement process
    Then the reinstatement should complete successfully
    And all data should be preserved during the status change

  @edge-case @concurrency
  Scenario: System behavior with concurrent reinstatement attempts
    Given I have an application in 'Notice of Cancellation' status
    When I click the 'Reinstate' button multiple times rapidly
    Then the system should process only one reinstatement request
    And duplicate requests should be prevented or handled gracefully
